author: MICHELANGELO RUCCI
title: Port Adelaide Crows unite to respect and farewell Phil Walsh at Showdown 39 |
text:
PORT Adelaide and the Crows want Showdown 39 to be marked by a celebration of Phil Walsh’s life rather than sorrow in his death.
The Power, as the host club for Sunday’s derby at Adelaide Oval, has detailed the running sheet for the Showdown that is to end with a minute’s applause rather than a minute’s silence for Walsh, who died on July 3.
The Power’s running sheet for Showdown 39 reads as:
The regular “March from the Mall” will begin at 1.30pm with an open invitation to Crows fans to join the Power supporters in their united entry to the Oval.
Each club will have its theme songs played as they take the field — and share a joint run-through banner that honours Walsh. The football community pays tribute to Phil Walsh 2:24 Play video
AFL: The football community have come together at Adelaide Oval to pay tribute to the late Phil Walsh.
Fox Sports 15 Jul 2015 Sport/AFL/News A special version of the Power’s “Never Tear Us Apart” anthem will be played in the 60 seconds before the first bounce to honour Walsh’s time at both clubs.
At the end of the game the winning club’s theme song will not be played. Both teams will unite for the presentation of the Showdown Trophy and the Showdown Medal followed by a minute’s applause as a final mark of respect to Walsh.
Memorial to Phil Walsh
Thomas says the AFL clubs want a celebration of Walsh’s life to mark Showdown 39.
“The amount of support that both clubs have received from each other over the past couple of weeks has been extraordinary and it’s great to able to continue that theme into Sunday’s Showdown,” Thomas said.
“From a supporter perspective, Port Adelaide is encouraging Crows fans to join our people on our traditional ‘March from the Mall’.
“And then for both teams to run through a joint banner is extremely significant and something which we may never see again.
“There’ll be some very special moments across the day including Never Tear Us Apart and the minute’s applause to conclude the afternoon.
“Rest assured though that in between these tributes both sides will be smashing into each other hell-bent on victory as only ‘Walshy’ would have wanted and expected.”
